properties.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 9:35AM CST by NWS Jackson MS
properties.description:
...The National Weather Service in Jackson has issued a Flood Warning
for the following rivers in Mississippi...

Pearl River Above Philadelphia affecting Neshoba County
Pearl River At Edinburg affecting Leake County
Tuscolameta Creek At Walnut Grove affecting Leake County

The National Weather Service in Jackson has issued a

* Flood Warning for
The Pearl River At Edinburg
* From late Sunday night until further notice.
* At  8:45 AM Friday the stage was 19.4 feet.
* Minor flooding is forecast.
* Flood stage is 20.0 feet.
* Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage Monday morning and
will continue to rise to near 20.5 feet Wednesday morning.
* Impact...At 21.0 feet...Minor over bank flooding continues in areas
south of the river.
* Impact...At 20.0 feet...Minor overbank flooding is occurring south
of the river.
properties.instruction:
Do not drive or walk through areas where water covers roadway! The
water may be deeper than it appears. Remember...Turn around, don't
drown!

Please note that forecast crests are based upon rainfall that has
occurred along with forecast rainfall for the next 24 hours. River
forecasts in the Tombigbee River Basin have an additional 48 hours of
rainfall added. Rainfall amounts greater than forecast may take the
rivers higher.

Additional information is available at:
https://water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=JAN

The next regularly scheduled update is expected tonight between 8 and
10 PM.
